title: Simplify admin panel authentication to username and password only

requirements.summary: Remove any verification or multi-step authentication process from the admin login flow. The admin panel should authenticate using only username and password credentials.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin login form displays only username and password fields
No verification step or additional authentication screens appear after entering credentials
Admin panel opens immediately upon successful username/password validation

file_operations.description: Simplify the admin login form to display only username and password input fields. Remove any multi-step authentication UI, verification prompts, or additional authentication screens. Ensure the form directly calls the useAdminAuth login function with username and password, and navigates to the admin panel immediately upon successful authentication without intermediate steps.

Review and simplify the authentication flow on the admin page. Ensure that once the user successfully logs in via AdminLoginForm, they are immediately granted access to the admin panel without additional verification screens, loading states, or processing steps. Remove any conditional rendering that might show intermediate authentication screens after login.

requirements.summary: Ensure that admin access is granted only when both the username and password match the actual stored credentials (username: 6352174912, password: 63521). Invalid credentials should be rejected.
acceptanceCriteria: Login succeeds only when username exactly matches 6352174912 and password exactly matches 63521
Any mismatch in username or password displays an error message
Partial matches or incorrect credentials do not grant access

file_operations.description: Review and ensure the login function performs exact string matching for both username (6352174912) and password (63521). The validation logic must reject any partial matches, case variations, or incorrect credentials. Ensure the error handling provides clear feedback when credentials don't match, and that the sessionStorage-based authentication state is only set when both credentials are exactly correct.

Ensure the form validation and error display properly show rejection messages when credentials are invalid. Display clear error feedback to the user when username or password doesn't match the stored credentials, and prevent form submission or navigation until exact matches are provided.

requirements.summary: Streamline the authentication process to be direct and simple with no additional processing steps or complexity beyond credential validation.
acceptanceCriteria: Authentication flow completes in a single step after submitting credentials
No loading states, intermediate screens, or unnecessary processing delays
User sees immediate feedback (success or error) after credential submission

file_operations.description: Streamline the login function to perform synchronous credential validation without async delays, network calls, or processing steps. Remove any artificial loading states or delays. The authentication state should be updated immediately in sessionStorage upon successful validation, enabling instant feedback to the user.

Remove any loading spinners, progress indicators, or delayed state transitions from the login form. Ensure the form provides immediate feedback (success or error) after credential submission. Upon successful validation, navigate directly to the admin panel without intermediate screens or processing delays.

Ensure the admin page renders immediately once authentication is confirmed, without showing loading states, verification screens, or processing overlays. Remove any unnecessary conditional rendering that might delay access to the admin panel after successful login.
